goals.question: What is the distribution of terrain types in the platformer game?
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us understand the frequency of different terrain types in the game and identify any patterns or imbalances.

goals.question: What is the average length of the levels in the platformer game?
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us understand the distribution of level lengths and identify any outliers or trends.

goals.question: What is the relationship between the number of enemies and the difficulty of the levels in the platformer game?
goals.visualization: Scatter plot of number of enemies vs. level difficulty
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us understand if there is a correlation between the number of enemies and the difficulty of the levels, which can inform level design decisions.

goals.question: What is the most common power-up in the platformer game?
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us understand the distribution of power-up types and identify any dominant or rare power-ups.

goals.question: What is the average completion time of the platformer game?
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us understand the distribution of completion times and identify any outliers or trends.

code:
import seaborn as sns
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import matplotlib.ticker as ticker
import pandas as pd

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    plt.figure(figsize=(6, 6))
    ax = sns.countplot(x='terrain_type', data=data)
    plt.title('What is the distribution of terrain types in the platformer game?', wrap=True)
    plt.xticks(rotation=45)
    if len(plt.xticks()[0]) > 20:
        ax.xaxis.set_major_locator(ticker.MaxNLocator(20))
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)
chart.show()

import seaborn as sns
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import matplotlib.ticker as ticker
import pandas as pd

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    plt.figure(figsize=(6, 6))
    sns.histplot(data=data, x='level_length', kde=True)
    avg_length = data['level_length'].mean()
    plt.axvline(avg_length, color='red', linestyle='--', label=f'Average Length: {avg_length:.2f}')
    plt.legend()
    plt.title('What is the average length of the levels in the platformer game?', wrap=True)
    if len(plt.xticks()[0]) > 20:
        plt.gca().xaxis.set_major_locator(ticker.MaxNLocator(20))
    plt.xticks(rotation=45)
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)
chart.show()

import seaborn as sns
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import matplotlib.ticker as ticker
import pandas as pd

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    plt.figure(figsize=(6, 6))
    sns.scatterplot(data=data, x='number_of_enemies', y='level_difficulty')
    if len(plt.xticks()[0]) > 20:
        plt.gca().xaxis.set_major_locator(ticker.MaxNLocator(20))
    plt.title('What is the relationship between the number of enemies and the difficulty of the levels in the platformer game?', wrap=True)
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)
chart.show()

import pandas as pd
import seaborn as sns
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import matplotlib.ticker as ticker

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    plt.figure(figsize=(6, 6))
    power_up_counts = data['power_up_type'].value_counts()
    plt.pie(power_up_counts, labels=power_up_counts.index, autopct='%1.1f%%')
    plt.title('What is the most common power-up in the platformer game?', wrap=True)
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)
chart.show()

import seaborn as sns
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import matplotlib.ticker as ticker
import pandas as pd

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    plt.figure(figsize=(6, 6))
    sns.boxplot(data=data['completion_time'])
    plt.title('What is the average completion time of the platformer game?', wrap=True)
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)
chart.show()
